title: Punkrock font on "Harajuku Lovers" T-shirt
content:
Hello,

I would like some help identifing this type face, or any suggestions of types that are similar.

Any help would be appreciated.  
See attachedment / link  
http://www.revolveclothing.com/images/HARA-WS63\_V2-BIG.jpg

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130214044752im_/http:/typophile.com/files/HARA-WS63_V2-BIG_5555.jpg)
author: Zulu Rose

comments.content:
Well, Zulu Rose, as no one has (until now) an exact match, I'll try a similar one with [Die Nasty](http://web.archive.org/web/20130214044752/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/larabie/die-nasty/) by Ray Larabie. The KISS-like S made me think of it.

EDIT: I still don't know what's written in the shirt: HARJUKU? HARAWKU? HARA...
I think someone has created a bastard, mixing Ray Larabies [Die Nasty](http://web.archive.org/web/20130214044752/http:/www.dafont.com/die-nasty.font) with a more"normal" sans.
Oooops... I was too slow when posting :-(

Hey Renko,

It reads Harajuku.. don't ask me what it means.
Harajuku is neigborhood (I think, maybe it's a street) in Tokyo that is famous for teenagers wearing strange outfits. Do a google search, you'll quickly understand :)
...or just listen to Gwen Stefani's L.A.M.B. album. fashion : music marketing :: music : fashion marketing. kind of a lame concept, but prolly made her a lot of $$$.

Interesting. Harajuku street. Never heard of it.  
And as someone quoted: "If you are not careful you'll learn something everyday."

Thanks to all.
